author: Jessica Stopper Life & Style
title: The Valley's Jesse Lally Reacts to Ex Michelle Saniei's Claims That He's 'Broke': 'Inappropriate'
text:
Celebrities
The Valley’s Jesse Lally Reacts to Ex Michelle Saniei’s Claims That He’s ‘Broke’: ‘Inappropriate’
Jesse Lally and estranged wife Michelle Saniei's divorce is getting uglier by the episode on The Valley season 2.
While defending herself against Jesse's claims that she slept with a man for money, Michelle, 36, accused him of being "broke" during the Tuesday, April 29, episode of the Bravo series. However, Jesse, 43, claimed otherwise.
"He is the one who is broke," Michelle tearfully said to her costars Brittany Cartwright, Nia Sanchez and Daniel Booko. "He cannot pay for rent. He spent all of our money, and he left me with nothing. He doesn't pay me one dollar of child support. Nothing. And now he's making up this rumor about me? I have a daughter, and he doesn't care."
Jesse reacted to Michelle's comments during The Valley After Show and called her financial claims "inappropriate."
"That should be saved for the family, but if Michelle wants to use it as her ammunition, then I'm just not going to comment on it," he said alongside costar Jax Taylor and Tom Schwartz.
However, Michelle didn't hold back during the After Show and shed light on what their life used to look like before she gave birth to their daughter, Isabella Bunny Lally, in 2020.
"We were very successful, in 2018, 2019, before I was pregnant, we were selling $20 million houses – $45 [million]. We did a $60 million deal and we were doing very, very good."
Michelle said that their finances took a tumble after Isabella was born, leading her to "work less." In turn, the real estate agent claimed that Jesse also "stopped working," but continued to spend money.
"We did have millions of dollars, and that money was gone," Michelle said.
Jesse later shared his side and shared that he and Michelle were "50-50 business partners."
"So, if our business was failing, we're both at equal fault – and Michelle had 100 percent access to all of our accounts," he shared, later adding, "So, if there was an issue with spending, Michelle is 100 percent at fault as well. And that's really all that I'm going to say about it."
Jesse and Michelle split in October 2023, one month after filming wrapped for The Valley season 1.
"I had the conversation with Jesse at the beginning of October that it was no longer going to work and I wanted to file for divorce," the family matriarch explained during an April 2024 episode of the "When Reality Hits" podcast. "Jesse and I have actually not been together since October, and since then, we were free to date and do whatever we want."
The pair has since moved on and entered new relationships.
Michelle confirmed she was in a relationship in April 2024 and went Instagram official with boyfriend Aaron Nosler two months later. The financial advisor made his debut on The Valley during season 2.
Jesse, for his part, went public with his girlfriend, Lacy Nicole, in April 2024. The couple are still together, despite Scheana Shay claiming that Lacy cheated on Jesse during The Valley season 2.
"The reason we're calling is, Michelle and I are here talking about my friend in Orange County. She just said to you that she's been sleeping with other guys," Jesse said to the Vanderpump Rules alum via phone call. "Is that true or false?"
Scheana, 39, claimed it was "correct verbatim," adding, "Even told me specifically who. The guy from Baywatch."
Neither Jesse nor Lacy has addressed the cheating rumors.
Copyright 2025 A360 Media. All rights reserved.
This story was originally published April 30, 2025 at 7:24 PM.

author: Devdiscourse News Desk
title: Apple Launches 'Age Assurance' to Protect Children's Privacy | Technology
text:
Apple Launches 'Age Assurance' to Protect Children's Privacy
Apple introduces a new method for parents to share their child's age with app developers without disclosing sensitive information, in response to debates over age-verification laws across the U.S. This 'age assurance' initiative aims to protect children's privacy while addressing legislative concerns.
Devdiscourse News Desk| Updated: 28-02-2025 03:29 IST | Created: 28-02-2025 03:29 IST
Apple on Thursday announced a new approach for parents to disclose their child's age to app developers without revealing sensitive details like birthdays or government IDs. This initiative aligns with ongoing discussions among U.S. lawmakers about age-verification requirements for social media and other apps.
With states like Utah and South Carolina debating legislation that would mandate app store operators such as Apple and Google to verify user ages, the tech industry faces a dilemma about responsibility. Meta has advocated for app stores to handle age verification when children download an app.
Apple expressed reluctance to collect sensitive data for verification, suggesting an 'age assurance' system that enables parents to share a child's age range instead of specific details. This method seeks to shield sensitive information while keeping parental control over third-party data sharing.
(With inputs from agencies.)

author: Ashlee Baracy
title: Here’s the 1st week of 2024 forecast for Metro Detroit
text: 4Warn Weather – Happy New Year! We are starting off 2024, and a new work week, pretty close to average. As temperatures drop below freezing this morning in our suburbs, any damp roads or sidewalks could turn into a few slick spots. Today’s sunrise is at 8:02 a.m. Clouds will hang tight on this Monday. Temperatures will top out in the seasonal mid-30s -- however, a northerly breeze will keep wind chill readings in the 20s throughout the day. Tonight’s sunset is at 5:12 p.m. Winds will shift tonight as skies clear. Lows will be in the upper 20s. Mild week with flurry chance As winds pick up out of the south-southwest on Tuesday, temperatures will rise into the upper 30s, close to 40 degrees, under mostly sunny skies. Wind gusts Tuesday will likely peak around 20-25 mph. Otherwise, we’ll have a pretty calm start to the new year. There’s a low-end chance for flurries on Wednesday due to an advancing cold front. That will usher in a cooler air mass on Thursday, bringing highs in the low 30s paired with some more sunshine. Elsewhere ... Nationally, a light wintry mix will impact parts of the mid-Atlantic, and some accumulating snowfall is expected across the Appalachians. Remember to download the free 4Warn weather app -- it’s easily one of the best in the nation. Just search your app store under WDIV and it’s right there available for both iPhones and Androids! Or click the appropriate link below.

author: infoLibre
title: Miles de personas llenan las calles de España para apoyar al pueblo palestino y exigir la ruptura con Israel
text: Miles de personas llenan las calles de España para apoyar al pueblo palestino y exigir la ruptura con Israel Varios miles de personas se han manifestado este sábado en Madrid y en otras ciudades de España, en favor de Palestina, para pedir el "fin del genocidio contra el pueblo palestino", exigir al Gobierno la ruptura de relaciones diplomáticas con Israel y la imposición de un embargo de armas. La manifestación ha sido secundada por diversas organizaciones y partidos como Podemos y Sumar y ha contado con la asistencia de la ministra de Juventud e Infancia del Gobierno, Sira Rego, que ha señalado en la red social X que ha acudido a la marcha "como una activista más" para pedir "la libertad del pueblo palestino y el cese inmediato del genocidio en Gaza". Bajo el lema 'Paremos el genocidio en Palestina', la organización convocante de la manifestación, Red Solidaria contra la Ocupación de Palestina (RESCOP), ha señalado que las declaraciones del presidente del Gobierno, Pedro Sánchez, "han sido importantes" pero que se deben "dar más pasos". "Basta ya de complicidad", ha demandado la portavoz de la entidad, Hania, en el transcurso de la marcha que ha empezado al mediodía en Atocha con destino a la Plaza de Cibeles. Esos pasos consisten en que España rompa relaciones con Israel e imponga un embargo de armas contra un Estado de Israel que "viola los Derechos Humanos y comete crímenes de lesa humanidad". Además, han instado al Gobierno Español a sumarse a la denuncia sudafricana contra el Estado de Israel en la Corte Penal Internacional (CIP) para "detener el genocidio". De su lado, el representante de Judíos Antiosionistas, Héctor Glad, ha destacado que "más de 180 organizaciones", entre ellas las organizaciones políticas Sumar, Más Madrid y Podemos, han apoyado la manifestación en la capital, en tanto que la protesta "se está replicando en casi cien ciudades en todo el Estado español" a lo largo del día. Durante la marcha, que se ha llevado a cabo sin incidentes, se han proclamado cánticos de apoyo a Palestina, tales como 'Desde el río hasta el mar, Palestina vencerá', 'Que viva la lucha del pueblo palestino', 'No es una guerra, es un genocidio'. Presencia de Sumar y Podemos A esta concentración en la capital se ha sumado el apoyo de líderes políticos. El diputado de Sumar y portavoz de IU en el Congreso, Enrique Santiago, ha exigido en declaraciones a los medios que Israel "detenga el genocidio y la ocupación" contra el pueblo palestino y, asimismo, ha demando que España se persone en la denuncia presentada contra Israel ante la CIP y que evite cometer "errores" que contribuirían a "extender" el conflicto en Oriente Próximo como la participación en la operación militar puesta en marcha en el Mar Rojo. En un línea similar, la eurodiputada perteneciente a Sumar, María Eugenia Palop, ha defendido el reconocimiento "urgente, incondicional y unilateral" del Estado de Palestina y el fin de las relaciones diplomáticas y comerciales con Israel. "No queremos financiar este genocidio ni nada que tenga que ver con la ocupación", ha sentenciado Palop para seguidamente alabar la "dignidad y valentía" de Sudáfrica por su denuncia en el CIP frente al "cinismo" de Israel, al que ha acusado de perpetrar un genocidio con "ensañamiento". Por su parte, la secretaria general de Podemos, Ione Belarra, ha exigido que España bloquee la misión de la Unión Europea para proteger barcos mercantes en el Mar Rojo, en la que el Gobierno ha dicho que no participará y que amenazó en un principio con vetar, y, con un matiz más contundente, ha arremetido con que Pedro Sánchez "nos está involucrando en una guerra contra Yemen, el país más pobre del mundo árabe, para ponerse del lado de los genocidas", en referencia a Israel. En sus declaraciones a los medios durante la marcha para pedir "el fin del genocidio que el Estado de Israel está cometiendo contra el pueblo de Palestina", la dirigente de la formación morada ha incidido en sus críticas contra el jefe del Ejecutivo al aducir que "nunca antes había habido un abismo tan profundo entre lo que quiere la gente de nuestro país y lo que está haciendo el gobierno". Marchas en Andalucía Miles de andaluces se han se han sumado también para pedir el alto el fuego en Gaza y exigir al Gobierno español "que rompa relaciones con Israel", según han declarado miembros de la Coordinadora Andalucía con Palestina. Estas manifestaciones se han celebrado en capitales de provincia como Cádiz, Granada, Jaén, Málaga y Sevilla, pero también en localidades como Alcalá de Guadaíra y Lebrija (Sevilla), Jerez de la Frontera y Sanlúcar de Barrameda (Cádiz) y Linares (Jaén). Javier García, portavoz de los manifestantes en Sevilla, ha informado de que los cálculos de la coordinadora son de 15.000 personas en la capital hispalense y otras 8.000 en la costasoleña. "Ha estado muy bien. Aquí en Sevilla, la cabecera iba ya a la altura de la Catedral y todavía había gente que no podía salir de Almirante Lobo", calle desde donde ha partido la marcha rumbo a la Plaza de San Francisco. Esta masiva respuesta de la ciudadanía es "una llamada de atención al Gobierno de España para que deje de hacer comercio armamentístico con un Estado que está cometiendo un genocidio televisado. España debe romper relaciones con Israel", ha clamado García. También están previstas dos manifestaciones para este domingo, en este caso en Almería y Córdoba. Cantabria El centro de Santander ha sido escenario este sábado de una manifestación en la que cerca de cinco centenares de personas han defendido la libertad de Palestina y han pedido "romper la relación con Israel". La movilización estaba convocada por el Comité de Solidaridad con los Pueblos-Interpueblos con el apoyo de numerosas organizaciones coincidiendo con las marchas que se han llevado a cabo hoy en más de cien ciudades españolas con el mismo fin. La de la capital cántabra ha partido pasadas las 12.00 horas rumbo a la Plaza del Ayuntamiento para leer un manifiesto. Al grito de "No es una guerra, es un genocidio" ha arrancado este recorrido, encabezado por una pancarta con el lema 'Paremos el genocidio en Gaza', seguida de otras con consignas como '75 años de apartheid o 'Las mujeres palestinas piden vida y libertad'. "El mensaje es claro: que se pare el genocidio, que se rompan las relaciones con Israel y que no se negocie más armamento", ha señalado a los medios Antonino Puente, de Interpueblos, al comienzo de la manifestación. Como ha destacado, el genocidio "no es algo de ahora, sino que lleva 100 años con un proyecto colonial y 56 con ocupación". La Rioja Una manifestación, que ha partido a las 13,00 horas, desde El Espolón de Logroño, frente a la Delegación del Gobierno en La Rioja, convocada por la coordinadora 'Amistad Palestina Rioja', ha recorrido el centro de la capital para exigir que se ponga fin al "genocidio" en Palestina y reclamar seguir con el "boicot" a los productos israelís y a las empresas que "colaboran" con Israel. [](https://www.infolibre.es/portada/espana-llena-manifestaciones-apoyo-pueblo-palestino-ruptura-relaciones-israel_6_1693050.html) España se llena de manifestaciones en apoyo al pueblo palestino y a "la ruptura de relaciones con Israel"Ver más La marcha iba encabezada por una gran pancarta en la que se podía leer 'Paremos el genocidio en Palestina', además de ir los participantes carteles en contra de Israel y en apoyo al pueblo palestino. Como es habitual, desde que se vienen celebrando estas protestas, desde el inicio de la guerra, han portado una gran bandera de Palestina. Se han coreado frases como "Israel, asesina", "Free Palestine" o "Estado español, cómplice" o "Vergüenza". Antes de iniciarse la manifestaciones Andrés Molina, que ha actuado como portavoz de la organización, ha señalado que "en general, se trata de continuar con una lucha que llevamos haciendo desde prácticamente el comienzo de esta nueva ofensiva de la guerra en Gaza, que fue el 7 de octubre, que no fue un comienzo de nada, fue simplemente el inicio de una nueva fase". "Queremos denunciar el genocidio, reclamar el reconocimiento de Palestina y denunciar y sancionar a Israel", porque "está llevando a cabo es un genocidio manual", ha apostillado.

author: PTI
title: Latest News | Intense Cold Conditions in Kashmir, Dense Fog in Several Places | LatestLY
text: Srinagar, Dec 29 (PTI) Dense fog shrouded many parts of Kashmir where the minimum temperature dropped several degrees below the freezing point, officials said on Friday. Kashmir is currently in the grip of "Chilla-i-Kalan", a 40-day harsh winter period, when temperatures drop considerably leading to the freezing of water bodies, including the Dal Lake, as well as water in supply lines. Also Read | India’s Remarkable Strides in 2023: A Year of Achievements Across Multiple Fronts. The chances of snowfall are the highest during this period and most areas, especially the higher reaches, receive heavy snowfall. "Chilla-i-Kalan" will end on January 31 and will be followed by the 20-day "Chilla-i-Khurd" and the 10-day "Chilla-i-Bachha". The minimum temperature in Srinagar settled at minus 3.3 degrees Celsius – same as the previous night, officials said. Also Read | Year Ender 2023: From Turkey-Syria Earthquake to Israel-Hamas War and Russia’s Failed Moon Mission, Here Are Top Nine Global Events of The Year. The visibility in Srinagar city and its adjoining areas was below 50 metres for the third day due to dense fog. The transport department has issued an advisory for motorists in the city and termed foggy conditions the worst in recent memory. The city and many other places in the valley have been witnessing foggy conditions over the past week. Though fog did not affect operations at the Srinagar International Airport, flights arriving from other cities in north India, including Delhi, were delayed due to bad weather conditions there, according to the Airports Authority of India. Pahalgam in south Kashmir's Anantnag district, which serves as one of the base camps for the annual Amarnath Yatra, recorded a minimum temperature of minus 5.4 degrees Celsius on Thursday night, the officials said. Gulmarg, a famous ski resort in Baramulla, recorded a low of minus 2.5 degrees Celsius. Qazigund recorded a low of minus 4.2 degrees Celsius, Kokernag town minus 2.6 degrees Celsius and Kupwara minus 4 degrees Celsius, the officials said. Ganderbal, Bandipora, and Budgam recorded the lowest temperature of the season at minus 6.7 degrees Celsius, an independent weather forecaster said. These areas also witnessed very dense fog. The dip in the minimum temperatures along with dense fog in several areas has caused many problems to the people. Apart from visibility issues, the cold and dry temperatures have increased common ailments like cough, cold, and other respiratory problems, especially among children and the elderly. The doctors have advised people, especially children, the elderly, and patients, to take precautions like wearing masks and not to venture out unnecessarily in the mornings and evenings. (This is an unedited and auto-generated story from Syndicated News feed, LatestLY Staff may not have modified or edited the content body)

author: Jose Beltran
title: Joe Biden anuncia que continuará como candidato en las Elecciones EE.UU. 2024: “Soy la persona más calificada para ser presidente” | lrtmus | Mundo | La República
text: Joe Biden anuncia que continuará como candidato: “Soy la persona más calificada para ser presidente” Biden anunció desde la Casa Blanca que, en medio de llamados para que se retire de carrera electoral, él "seguirá moviéndose". En Estados Unidos, después de varios días de incertidumbre y especulaciones, el presidente Joe Biden, actual candidato por el Partido Demócrata, declaró hoy en una rueda de prensa desde la Casa Blanca que continuará como candidato del Partido Demócrata en las Elecciones USA 2024: "Estoy en esto para completar el trabajo que comencé." No obstante, durante la rueda de prensa el aún candidato demócrata se noto cansado y hasta dijo "vicepresidente Trump" al referirse a Kamala Harris en su respuesta a la primera pregunta de la noche, cuando se le cuestionó si sería la indicada para reemplazarlo. "Mira, yo no habría elegido a la vicepresidenta Trump como vicepresidenta... creo que ella no estaba calificada para ser presidenta, así que comencemos por ahí", dijo Biden en conferencia de prensa. PUEDES VER: [El mayor exportador de productos del mundo duplica su presencia naval y provoca alerta máxima en Estados Unidos] Sigue la transmisión de la rueda de prensa de Joe Biden EN VIVO ¿Qué dijo Joe Biden respecto a su continuidad como candidato a la presidencia? Durante la conferencia de prensa, realizada el 11 de julio en la Casa Blanca, Joe Biden negó que se acuesta temprano y limita su agenda para sentirse menos agotado. "Mira, lo que dije fue que, en lugar de empezar todos los días a las 7 y acostarme a medianoche, sería más inteligente para mí controlarme un poco más", fue su respuesta. Por otro lado, en sus comentarios sobre su agenda tras el debate, Biden mencionó: "Aprecio a mi equipo, pero si siempre añado más cosas, mi esposa me reprende". Asimismo, se refirió a la situación que pasa Ucrania frente a Rusia, afirmando que está abierto para hablar con cualquier líder mundial, pero que no espera que Putin haya cambiado su posición sobre la guerra. "Creo que estoy dispuesto a hablar con cualquier líder que quiera hacerlo, incluso si Putin me llama y quiere hablar", anunció Biden durante la conferencia de prensa. La presión de Biden para renunciar a su candidatura 2024 Luego de una aplastante derrota durante el primer debate presidencial 2024, diferentes autoridades, integrantes del Partido Demócrata y hasta estrellas conocidas en el mundo del entretenimiento, han pedido al actual presidente dar un paso al costado en estas elecciones de Estados Unidos. En ese mismo sentido, demócratas de la Cámara de Representantes han pedido a sus integrantes dar sus expresiones y opiniones al respecto. Según CBS News, los próximos días serán brutales, llenos de declaraciones y críticas, por lo que la semana que viene podría definifir si Biden se mantiene en carrera pese a su anuncio durante la conferencia de prensa HOY. Uno de los más recientes en dar su opinión fue el actor George Clooney, quien a pesar de ser uno de los principales recaudadores de fondos para el Partido Demócrata, le pidió abandonar la carrera electoral: "no es algo que se pueda revertir. No vamos a ganar en noviembre con él". Durante una entrevista a The New York Times, el conocido actor mencionó que consideraba al actual presidente un amigo, pero que la única batalla que no puede ganar es contra el tiempo, al referirse a su edad.

author: @wluctv6
title: Light snow today then hazardous travel with next system
text: Light snow today then hazardous travel with next system A clipper system tracking through the Great Lakes is bringing light scattered snow showers. Moderate intensities will occur in the east with some lake enhancement off Lake Michigan. Snow amounts will range from 1-3″, but higher amounts will be possible in Delta, Alger, and Schoolcraft counties. Attention shifts to a stronger storm system, which develops in the Central Plains. It is a slow-moving system and will bring impacts over several days. Light snow starts in the Western U.P. Sunday afternoon and becomes widespread Sunday night through Monday. Rain/snow mix develops late on Monday. Then, as the low gets closer warmer air will cause precipitation to shift to widespread rain for Tuesday. Plan on sloppy road conditions on Monday and wet on Tuesday. Snow amounts are still trending highest in the Western U.P. with around 6″ by Monday possibly with 1-3″ in the east. Stay tuned for changes! Today: Light scattered snow showers >Highs: Upper 20s to low 30s Saturday: Spotty snow showers in the morning >Highs: Low to mid 20s north, upper 20s south Sunday: Afternoon light snow in the west. Then, spreading east during the evening >Highs: Low 30s Monday: Widespread snow and mix > Highs: Mid to upper 30s Tuesday: Widespread rain and warmer >Highs: Low to mid-40s Wednesday: Cloudy with lake-effect snow along the northwest wind belts >Highs: Upper 20s to low 30s Thursday: Spotty snow in the north >Highs: Upper 20s to low 30s Copyright 2024 WLUC. All rights reserved.

author: Uniindia News Service
title: Stalin announces more assistance for Liquor Tragedy victims
text: States » SouthPosted at: Jun 21 2024 4:37PM Stalin announces more assistance for Liquor Tragedy victimsChennai, June 21 (UNI) Observing that the sadness and grief the Kallakurichi spurious liquor tragedy had caused could not be expressed in words, Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M.K. Stalin on Friday gave a detailed reply in the State Assembly on the steps taken by it, including Rs ten lakh solatium to the deceased families, and also announced more assistance, including meeting the educational expenses of their wards till they pursue higher education. In a detailed reply to a Special Calling Attention motion given notice of by Members of various political parties, during Zero Hour in the Assembly, Mr Stalin said in the Kallakurichi incident, of the 164 affected, 117 were being treated as in-patients and 47 people have died. A total of 67 people were undergoing treatment in Kallkurichi Government Medical College hospital, 32 in Salem Government College hospital, two in Villuppuram Government Medical College hospital and 16 at JIPMER in Puducherry.He pointed out that the government had already announced an assistance of Rs ten lakh to the families of the deceased.Announcing more help and assistance to the victims, Mr Stalin informed the House that the state government would bear the educational expenses and hostel fees of all children, who have lost either one or both of their parents in hooch tragedy, until they finish their graduation. Mr Stalin said apart from the already announced Rs 10 lakh assistance, the government would provide a maintenance allowance of Rs 5,000 per month to children who have been orphaned in the tragedy and would be brought up by a guardian. This amount will be given till they complete 18 years of age, he said. . He said the government will also deposit Rs 5 lakh as corpus in a bank in the names of these children and this amount along with the accrued interest, will be given to them when they turn 18. Announcing an assistance of Rs three lakh each from the Chief Minister's Public Relief fund for those children who have lost one of their parents, Mr Stalin priority would be given to the children, who have lost both or one of their parents, in all government schemes. The Chief Minister said if the children, if they are willing, would be admitted to government-run homes or homes functioning with government aid.Responding to some member's remarks that the Chief Minister should own responsibility for the tragedy, Mr Stalin said as the one holding the home portfolio and also as the Chief Minister, he would run away and hide on any issues.He also pointed out to the action taken against erring district police officials, transfer of District Collector, suspension of the District SP and PEW personnel, ordering a CB-CID probe, besides a Judicial probe into the incident. Mr. Stalin also said the hooch was brought from Puducherry and methanol was used in it and three people have been arrested so far and 200 litres of methanol were seized.Referring to the cases that were pending in Courts against the Ministers and top police officials for their involvement in Gutkha scam when the Opposition Party (meaning the AIADMK) was in power, Mr Stalin said he has the list of hooch tragedy deaths that took place during the AIADMK regime."But I do not want to politicise it by talking about it", he said and appealed to the members not to seek political mileage by using this tragic incident. Reiterating that the government was taking stringent action against those involved in illicit brewing and they have been arrested under the Goondas Act, the Chief Minister said a total of 4,63,710 cases were registered against illicit liquor peddlers and 4,61,084 people were arrested. A total of 565 people were detained under the Goondas Act, 16,51,633 litres of illicit liquor and 1,42,019 litres of rectified spirit were seized an destroyed. He said since the DMK came to power, 14,606 cases were registered against the manufacture and sale of spurious liquor have been filed and a total of 10,154 people have been arrested of which 58 were detained under the Goondas Act. He also listed out the steps taken by his government and the number of arrests made during the last year's twin hooch tragedy in Villuppuram and Chengalpattu districts. UNI GV 1620Tags: #Stalin announces more assistance for Liquor Tragedy victims

author: deccanchronicle.com
title: Fact Check: Viral Portrait Behind Rahul, Sonia Gandhi’s Selfie Is Not Of Christ
text:
Fact Check: Viral Portrait Behind Rahul, Sonia Gandhi’s Selfie Is Not Of Christ Fact Check NewsMobile 25 May 2024 8:47 PM GMT x The image is shared with a caption: “Janeudhari Brahmin” Rahul Gandhi has Jesus’s picture in his room…No picture of Hindu gods in the same room…Nice!’. Claim : In the 6th phase of the Lok Sabha elections on May 25, Congress Leader Rahul Gandhi with mother Sonia Gandhi cast their votes in Delhi. Following this, a selfie of the mother-son duo showing their inked fingers has gone viral on social media, with users claiming that the poster behind them depicts Jesus Christ.
The image is shared with a caption: “Janeudhari Brahmin” Rahul Gandhi has Jesus’s picture in his room…No picture of Hindu gods in the same room…Nice!’.
Fact Check: NewsMobile fact-checked the claim, and found it to be false.
Upon closer examination of the viral image, the NM team noticed three distinct red dots in the poster behind them. Such a detail is uncommon in pictures of Jesus Christ. Upon cropping the image in question and conducting a Reverse Image Search, we traced the image to a website MeisterDrucke , where it was identified as “Madonna Oriflamma, 1932”, an artwork by Nicholas Roerich.
WikiArt describes Nicholas Roerich as a multifaceted Russian figure, renowned as a painter, writer, archaeologist, theosophist, and public figure. He is regarded by some in Russia as an enlightener, philosopher, and spiritual influencer, particularly influenced by a spiritual movement in Russian society during his youth. One of Roerich’s remarkable artworks is Madonna Oriflamma, which exemplifies his mastery of the symbolism style. Here is an image for a more in-depth analysis and comparison.
Hence, it’s evident that the viral portrait behind Rahul Gandhi’s selfie doesn’t depict Jesus Christ, but an artwork. Disclaimer: This story was published first on NewsMobile , republished by Deccan Chronicle as part of Shakti collective.

author: Mirage News
title: Efficient CO2 Use in Creating Biodegradable Plastics via Advanced Artificial Photosynthesis Catalyst | Mirage News
text: Amid growing global concern over climate change and plastic pollution, researchers at Osaka Metropolitan University are making great strides in the sustainable production of fumaric acid – a component of biodegradable plastics such as polybutylene succinate, which is commonly used for food packaging. The researchers have managed to efficiently produce fumaric acid, which is traditionally derived from petroleum, using renewable resources, carbon dioxide, and biomass-derived compounds. In a previous study, a research team led by Professor Yutaka Amao of the Research Center for Artificial Photosynthesis at Osaka Metropolitan University demonstrated the synthesis of fumaric acid from bicarbonate and pyruvic acid, a biomass-derived compound, using solar energy. They also succeeded in producing fumaric acid using carbon dioxide obtained directly from the gas phase as a raw material. However, the yield in the production of fumaric acid remained low. In their latest research, published in [Dalton Transactions](https://doi.org/10.1039/D3DT03492E), the researchers have now developed a new photosensitizer and further advanced an artificial photosynthesis technique that doubles the yield of fumaric acid compared to conventional methods. "This is an extremely important advancement for the complex bio/photocatalyst system. It is a valuable step forward in our quest to synthesize fumaric acid from renewable energy sources with even higher yields, steering us toward a more sustainable future," said Professor Amao.
